history.content:
I've heard most people say 61BL can be better or the same as 61B, never worse.  The primary reasons I have seen/heard for 61BL being better is:

1. 61BL most likely is your only class so all your time can be dedicated into the class therefore you can maximize knowledge gains

2. since it's lab based you get more coding practice.  Like they say, the best way to learn this stuff is by actually doing it.

----

My $.02 after lab assisting for 61BL / having friends take it: 

61BL is completely lab focused: you're sitting in the same lab in the basement of soda 3 hours a day 4 days a week, with only 1 lecture a week. From what I've seen / dealt with, no one learns concepts to the same fundamental level as they should through labs: labs are all about hacking something together so it's good enough that your TA will check you off on it. Most of the interesting part of 61B comes from the big projects and the interesting lectures, and you'll get neither of those in 61BL. I'd personally recommend against taking it if you want to really learn the material well / enjoy 61B, but if your main goal is to get to upper divs ASAP / you learn well from labs, then go for it.

I've heard most people say 61BL can be better or the same as 61B, never worse.  The primary reasons I have seen/heard for 61BL being better is:

1. 61BL most likely is your only class so all your time can be dedicated into the class therefore you can maximize knowledge gains

2. since it's lab based you get more coding practice.  Like they say, the best way to learn this stuff is by actually doing it.

children.subject: Nope! You actually get more face time with instructors to learn the material since it is lab based. Last summer, there was lecture once a week by the head instructors and mini-lectures during lab time by your TA's.
So every lab begins with lecture from TA, and after that we do the lab exercise?
But there are only 8 lectures in total... Can the lectures cover same amount of materials as CS 61B of regular semester?

The primary means of learning in CS61BL is not though lecture, but through lab. As said above, your lab TA will start lab with a 15-60 minute mini-lecture (depending on their style), after which you will work on the lab exercises to practice the day's material. It does indeed cover the same amount as regular 61B, but is notably faster paced.
But does it mean that we self-learn the materials of CS 61B?

history.content:
I signed up for CS 61BL think summer but some friends advise me against taking it. However, I am looking for an internship next summer so I am debating between taking CS 61BL during summer or CS 61B during fall.

I noticed that CS 61BL has only 1 lecture per week. Does it mean that most of the time it is a self-learning course in lab? If so, is it a good idea to self-learn such important materials?

Also, it is possible to get a summer internship next year if I take CS 61B during fall? When do companies usually conduct interview?
history.subject: CS 61BL Structure?
